timeline.bodyText: I don't think this added parameter is a good idea. Why not just injecting the MuleContext and using the isStopping() method?
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText: This isn't a matter of not populating the cache. If the context is stopping, the dynamic config shouldn't be spawned at all.
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

timeline.bodyText:
this if seems to be inverted, but also conceptually wrong..
if the context is not stopping, then you need to do getConfiguration() as usual so that the cache is used. If the context IS stopping, then no new config should be created. Also, the compute method you added should never be explicitly called. If a dynamic config is not added to the cache, then it will never be stopped and will generate a leak.
timeline.author: marianogonzalez

replies.bodyText: the cache is a loading cache, that's the issue, doing a get on it populates it, that's what i'm avoiding with this change, and generating a different compute method
replies.author: elrodro83

replies.bodyText: I know.. my point is that a get() to a dynamic config should simply fail when the context is stopping.
replies.author: marianogonzalez
